how would you describe your main use cas: Note-taking;Task and project management (including CRMs);Producing/publishing interactive fiction;Worldbuilding (e.g. for role-playing games);Narrative fiction writing (either supporting its creation or directly writing in TiddlyWiki)
do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: No, but I may export content into other formats and share individual tiddlers, the whole wiki, or an extract of the wiki
putting it all together, what value does: It has been a limited but useful resource for organizing and writing my fiction and worldbuilding. Being able to search and sort by tags has been especially useful, as well as being able to write in and display html and markdown pages with custom css. Color coded tags, too.
what is your level of ability with tiddl: I have customised TiddlyWiki through options and plugins;I have written custom CSS styles
how do you save changes in tiddlywiki?: Single-file wiki through web browser with Download Saver (default saving mechanism);Single-file wiki with TiddlyDesktop;Single-file wiki third-party mobile app (e.g. Tiddloid, Quine)
how do you back up/sync changes between: Neocities, Nekoweb, tiiny.host, omg.lol and similar services;DIY (any other solution)
as you selected diy, would be grateful f: I use syncthing to sync folders... i store a single file wiki locally and sync across devices.
outside of plugins, palettes and other i: I sometimes poke around but I can’t remember any specific changes.
what are we doing well? prompts for thin: The self-editing page stuff is good. The flexibility can be daunting but is ultimately good. The wiki format is very useful. The ability to control how and how many tiddlers are displayed is cool. Being plugin-friendly is very useful. The fact that it’s free, the fact that it’s import/export friendly for the most part... The drag and drop features are cool.
what could we do better? prompts for thi: I’m currently phasing out of tw into just a folder full of sloppy mishmashed files, not because I want to, but because my story is humongous and my wiki is lagging so hard that I’ve lost important writing while editing directly in it. I first moved from google docs to TW for the same reason... googdocs crashed after chapter 13ish, tw crashes after about chapter 50. I’m sad my use case isn’t a neat fit for tw. I looked so hard to find a tool and tw was it. Im out of options. I have to diy it now.
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
title: Community Survey 2025 Answer 00069
